(Simplified: 璎)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 嬰 indicates the sound; 王 (jade) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 王 [ wáng ] king, ruler; royal; surname
    • 嬰 [ yīng ] baby, infant; to bother
①(瓔珞)古代一種用珠玉穿成串、戴在頸項上的裝飾品。
瓔珞 [ yīng luò ]: jade or pearl necklace

瓔字的基本解释

yīng

瓔字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yīng］
［《廣韻》於盈切，平清，影。］
“璎1”的繁体字。
(1)似玉的美石。
(2)即璎珞。玉饰。

瓔字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【玉字部】　瓔； 康熙笔画：22； 页码：页745第16
【廣韻】於盈切【集韻】【韻會】伊盈切，?音嬰。【玉篇】?蒼云：瓔珢，石似玉也。　又【廣韻】瓔珞，頸飾。　又【集韻】於莖切【正韻】於京切，?音罌。義同。

瓔字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
瓔字的起名意思

本意指似玉的美石，也有玉珠之义，如璎玑。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Wu Ji 1] [Jade Character Department] 　ying; Kangxi strokes: 22; page number: page 745 to 16
[Guang Yun] Yu Yingqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Yi Yingqie, Yinying. [Jade articles] Cang Yun: Yinglue, stone is like jade.　[Guang Yun] Ying Luo, neck decoration.　[Ji Yun] cut in stem [zheng rhyme] cut in Jing,? Yin pop. The same meaning.

Ying
Name meaning
The original meaning refers to the beautiful stone like jade, but also has the meaning of jade pearl, such as Yingji.
yīng
a necklace made of precious stones
